Segmentation Factory¶

class SegmentationFactory.SegmentationFactory[source]¶

Create different types of segmentations

The results are saved to SegmentationProperty object

Methods

BallTreeSurfaceElementSegmentation(points[, …]) Partitioning a given point set to surface elements of minimal object size using a ball-tree data-structure :param points: point set object (PointSet) :param leafSize: smallest number of points allowed in the ball tree data-structure (int) :param smallestObjectSize: smallest object expected to be detected in the point set (float) :return: SegmentationFactory
ParabolicScanLineSegmentation(pointSet, …)
SurfaceElementsTensorConnectedComponents(points)
param points:point set object (PointSet)

classmethod BallTreeSurfaceElementSegmentation(points, leafSize=10, smallestObjectSize=0.1)[source]¶

Partitioning a given point set to surface elements of minimal object size using a ball-tree data-structure :param points: point set object (PointSet) :param leafSize: smallest number of points allowed in the ball tree data-structure (int) :param smallestObjectSize: smallest object expected to be detected in the point set (float) :return: SegmentationFactory

classmethod ParabolicScanLineSegmentation(pointSet, scanResolutionAz, searchRatio=0.75, ransacRatio=0.025, minimalScanLineLength=500)[source]¶
classmethod SurfaceElementsTensorConnectedComponents(points, leafSize=10, smallestObjectSize=0.1, numNeighbors=10, varianceThreshold=0.01, linearityThreshold=5, normalSimilarityThreshold=0.01, distanceThreshold=0.01, mode='soft_clipping')[source]¶
Parameters:
  • points – point set object (PointSet)
  • leafSize – smallest number of points allowed in the ball tree data-structure (int)
  • smallestObjectSize – smallest object expected to be detected in the point set (float)
  • numNeighbors – number of neighboring surface elements to find (int)
  • varianceThreshold – max allowed variance of a surface tensor (float)
  • linearityThreshold – the value between the two largest eigenvalues from which a tensor is considered as a linear one (float)
  • normalSimilarityThreshold – max difference allowed between the directions of the tensors, given in values of the angle sine (float)
  • distanceThreshold – max distance between two tensors (float)
  • mode – similarity function indicator. Valid values include: ‘binary’ (default), ‘soft_clipping’ and ‘exp’
Returns:
